title: Ep 1. Talking with Brett Howlett, Project Director for Riverlee’s Seafarers Project
excerpt: Today we talk with Brett Howlett, the Project Director of the $500m Seafarers project by Riverlee – recognisable to Melburnians by the historic ‘Malcolm Moore Crane’ at the Port of Melbourne.
author: Building Environs

sections.heading: Ep 1. Talking with Brett Howlett, Project Director for Riverlee’s Seafarers Project

sections.content: Today we talk with +[Brett Howlett](https://www.linkedin.com/in/brett-howlett-49294b32/)+, the Project Director of the $500m Seafarers project being developed by the Melbourne developer, +[Riverlee](https://www.riverlee.com.au/)+ – recognisable to Melburnians by the historically significant ‘Malcolm Moore Crane’ at the Port of Melbourne.

We discuss property development in Melbourne and what the future of development may look like in a post-Covid city. Brett shares his views on a career in large-scale project development and what he’s learned delivering some of the most recognisable towers along the Yarra.

+[The Building Talks Podcast](https://www.linkedin.com/company/the-building-talks-podcast/?viewAsMember=true)+ is a fortnightly show focusing on the people, projects, and topics within Melbourne’s built environment of construction, property, architecture, and engineering.
If you’re interested in Melbourne’s property development sector, this show is for you…

sections.title: Ep 1. Talking with Brett Howlett, Project Director for Riverlee’s Seafarers Project
